channel.title: Music cases
channel.description: how would i get the cases for my music tab? theres nothing in them so idk how to get them

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Well you can start by loading the interface…

Read full topic

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:15, topic:480370”]Or, instead of loveing about in the client, just do this:

[code=Java]
switch (buttonId) {
case 1:
doStuff();
break;

// ...
default:
    System.out.println("Unhandled button: " + buttonId);
    break;

}
[/code][/quote]
Zyle, he wants to populate the music tab. If you haven’t noticed 7/10 of clients don’t even have that made. The only code for it, I’m assuming, is the tab button. So he needs to create the stuff inside the tab, via client, then edit it in the server.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

…? What do u mean zyle?
Thanks for reply

Read full topic

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Or, instead of fucking about in the client, just do this:

switch (buttonId) {
    case 1:
        doStuff();
        break;

    // ...
    default:
        System.out.println("Unhandled button: " + buttonId);
        break;
}

Read full topic

in which ever java file that handles your interfaces. Each button id is a seperate string. So something like button id 3 would be string id 3.

You’d still have to create the interface via your client. Then add the clicking actions server sided

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

OGolemX:

Yes i guess you could call it that, but in the source they call it a case, so i didnt know what i could say lol. Yes i want to create the music tab, but i just want to add clickable commands into it, i dont want music in it

You’d still have to create the interface via your client. Then add the clicking actions server sided (usually)

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

That would be called a button id, not a case. Cases are in any switch statement. Depending on what the switch statement is being used for, depends on what it’s called.

Read full topic

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“OGolemX, post:6, topic:480370”]In allstar rsps, there are cases. A case is a spot that holds a command or void or a text, example :
Case 185:
Customcommand (“home”)
}
that means if you clicked case 185 you would teleport to home.
Cases are also used for clicking on objects and items in allstar. I dont know what its called in other revisioned servers.[/quote]
facepalm
That case is in a switch statement for your clicking buttons…
You’re looking to create the music tab, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Music cases
item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

In allstar rsps, there are cases. A case is a spot that holds a command or void or a text, example :
Case 185:
Customcommand (“home”)
}
that means if you clicked case 185 you would teleport to home.
Cases are also used for clicking on objects and items in allstar. I dont know what its called in other revisioned servers.

Read full topic
